title: FRQ Score
stimulusHtml:
Select a point value to view scoring criteria and/or translations and to score the response.

One point is awarded for each correctly translated segment. Student must correctly translate all words in a given segment to receive credit for that segment.

Note: The passage is segmented in such a way as to achieve a balance of easy, medium, and hard segments. Glosses are added to the passage only in order to make a given segment easier, so uncommon words in harder segments will not necessarily be glossed.

Note: The model translation provided below is merely a suggestion of how the passage might accurately be translated. Teachers should use their discretion in accepting alternative translations of any given segment.
descriptions:
The response does not accurately include any of the translations below.

· Segment 1: O patria [O fatherland, native land, homeland, land, country, home city]

· Segment 2: O domus [O house, household, home, dwelling (place), seat]

· Segment 3: divum Ilium et [of the gods, divine (beings), divinities, deified (ones); Ilium, Troy [must be vocative]; and]

· Segment 4: incluta bello [famous, renowned, celebrated; in/from/because of/for war, warfare, fighting, battle]

· Segment 5: moenia Dardanidum [walls, fortifications, barriers, bulwarks [must be vocative]; of the Dardanians, Trojans [or possessive]; Trojan, Dardanian]

· Segment 6: Quater atque quater [four times and four times]

· Segment 7: substitit [halted, stopped, came to a stop, stood (firm), ceased (going), stuck, hesitated, remained (in place), tarried, stayed, became lodged/stuck/etc. [must be third-person singular]]

· Segment 8: ipso [itself, the very [must modify limine]]

· Segment 9: in limine portae [on, at, in, upon; threshold, beam, doorstep, doorway, door, sill, entrance, entryway, gateway, opening, boundary; of the gate(s), door, entryway, opening [or possessive]]

· Segment 10: arma dedere [arms, weapons, armor, implements/equipment (of war) [must be nominative]; gave, offered, presented, delivered, produced, caused, rendered, made (with sonitum)]

· Segment 11: utero sonitum [from/in the belly, abdomen, womb, uterus, internal cavities/places/etc., insides, innards, stomach; sound, noise, rumbling, rattling, ringing, clatter, groan, roar, echo]

· Segment 12: instamus tamen immemores caeci que [we press on, continue, keep on, be urgent/act urgently, insist, urge on, persevere, persist [or equivalent past tense]; but, however, nevertheless, nonetheless, still, even so, in spite, all/just the same, yet; forgetful, unmindful, not remembering, heedless, lacking memory, forgetting, mindless; blind, blinded, unseeing, senseless, impaired (in judgement), undiscerning, unknowing, dull, stupid, unforeseeing, undirected, misdirected, uncertain; and]

· Segment 13: furore [with/by/from/in/because of madness, delirium, frenzy, distress, rage, fury, anger, passion, zeal, excitement, fervor]

· Segment 14: et monstrum infelix [and; monster, portent, unnatural/awful/dreadful thing, prodigy, omen, horror, atrocity, beast, creature; unfortunate, misfortunate, unlucky, inauspicious, disastrous, ill-fated, fateful, unhappy, wretched, miserable, infelicitous, unprosperous, unfruitful, unproductive, [must modify monstrum]]

· Segment 15: sacrata sistimus arce [sacred, hallowed, holy, august, revered, inviolable, consecrated, devoted, enshrined, exalted, sanctified, made divine [must modify arce]; we place, set (up/down/in place), (cause to) stand, erect, plant, station, put, fix, make firm, establish (in place) [or equivalent past tense]; on/in/upon/at/within the citadel, fortification(s), strong point, city, fortress, stronghold, bulwark, defense, sanctuary, refuge, shelter, summit, peak]
The response accurately includes one of the translations below.
The response accurately includes two of the translations below.
The response accurately includes three of the translations below.
The response accurately includes four of the translations below.
The response accurately includes five of the translations below.
The response accurately includes six of the translations below.
The response accurately includes seven of the translations below.
The response accurately includes eight of the translations below.
The response accurately includes nine of the translations below.
The response accurately includes 10 of the translations below.
The response accurately includes 11 of the translations below.
The response accurately includes 12 of the translations below.
The response accurately includes 13 of the translations below.
The response accurately includes 14 of the translations below.
The response accurately includes all 15 of the translations below.
